metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33574 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
The mq_notify function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) versions 2.32 and 2.33 has a use-after-free. It may use the notification thread attributes object (passed through its struct sigevent parameter) after it has been freed by the caller, leading to a denial of service (application crash) or possibly unspecified other impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33574` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc-bin - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc6 - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc6-amd64 - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc6-i386 - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc6-prof - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc6-s390 - 2.34-0ubuntu1
libc6-x32 - 2.34-0ubuntu1
locales - 2.34-0ubuntu1
locales-all - 2.34-0ubuntu1
nscd - 2.34-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> see https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896#c4 for a discussion on what pre-requisites are needed for an attack based on this vulnerability. affects more than just 2.32 and 2.33 mdeslaur> upstream fix introduced CVE-2021-38604, if this CVE is fixed, the other needs to be fixed also. Fixing this CVE would require introducing new symbols which will likely cause regressions for running systems. We will not be fixing this CVE in Ubuntu stable releases. Marking as ignored.

criterions.comment: glibc package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.34-0ubuntu1').
